serverinfo-text:
Rogue House Community Server Guide
Your Journey Begins...
Join the Discord! - Vintage Story Wiki

Well, look who's finally awake. You've been out for a few days. You don't remember what happened? We found you in the forest, wounded and unconscious. And just in time, too! We could hear the howling of wolves approaching.

Brought you back here to get you patched up, although it looked pretty grim. Wasn't sure you were gonna make it but you pulled through! Now that you're here, you best be Respectful. We won't be having any Theft or Fighting around here.

Have a look around, get your barrings. Maybe grab a drink at the Rogue House Tavern, just up the path. Oh! And don't go alone... Take this! (Use /starterkit to receive your gift)
Welcome to Rogue House.

Starter Guide - Progression Guide - Claims Guide - Chat Group Guide

This is Survival PvE. That means No Teleports. No Creative Spawned Items. No PvP.
Settings:
-Slightly Reduced Hunger Speed
-Half Reduced Food Spoilage
-Base HP Set to 20
-Aggression Enabled
-Items Drop on Death
-60 Days per Month
-Calender Paused When Empty
-Chiseling for Most Blocks
-Rifts Enabled
-Rare Temporal Storms
-Temporal Stability Enabled
-Underground Farming Enabled
-Proximity Chat
-General Chat Linked to Discord


RogueRaidenTV, Server Owner & Admin
DiZz, Server Mod & Builder


Fund the Servers - RogueRaiden Live on Twitch - Tip RogueRaiden
claimsguide-text:
Claims & Land Ownership Guide
Now you're getting somewhere!

In Multiplayer Vintage Story, you have the ability to Claim Land to protect your builds from harm. This is a very important step to keep unwanted Players from stealing your items or, even worse, claim your home for themselves!

Getting Started with Claims
Note: Do not type the Square [ ] Brackets!

/land claim new Use to start a New Claim and mark the Start Point.

/land claim start Mark the Start Point corner of your Claim.

/land claim end Mark the End Point corner of your Claim.

Once both corners are marked, a yellow cuboid will appear showing the area of the Claim. You can fine tune the area with these direction commands:

/land claim g[n/e/s/w/u/d] to grow and /land claim s[n/e/s/w/u/d] to shrink your Claim Area. For example, you would use "/land claim gu 2" to grow your Claim Area UP by 2 blocks and "/land claim sn" to shrink your Claim Area's North Side by 1 block.

/land claim add This will add your current Claim Area to the Claim. The yellow cuboid will turn green. You may now finalize your claim or add more Claim Areas.

/land claim save [claimName] This will finalize and Save your Claim with given Name. The Name is Optional.

/land claim list Lists all of your current claims showing their Index Number.

/land claim load [index] Loads the claim with assigned Index Number.

/land free [index] This will Delete claim with assigned Index Number. Must be confirmed with /land free [index] confirm.


Granting Access to Players and Player Groups

First, load your claim with /land claim load [index].

/land claim grant [playerName] [use/all] This will grant the Player with either Use-Can open doors, chests, pickup things OR all-Can build and break block.

/land claim grantgroup [groupName] [use/all] Same as above, but with Player Groups.
rhwolftamingguide-text:
Wolf Taming Guide
A Seraph's best friend.

The first steps to taming yourself a wolf is finding a puppy in the wild or purchasing one at a Trader.

Once you have obtained a puppy, you want to feed it raw meat or bones. This will prompt a chat message about the tame progress. Raw poultry and raw red meat give the most progress while bones and raw bushmeat give the least. Once the pup is tamed, it is time to name it.

Continued feeding will increase the Obedience of your new pet. Most commands can only be executed once a certain level of obedience is reached. Crouch right-click on your pet to get a listing of all available commands. Most commands are pretty straight forward. The "Stay" command allows your pet to roam in about a 10 block area.

When tired, your dogs will prefer sleeping in certain spots. Adult dogs prefer blocks covered by linen or rush mats, pups prefer beds. There are a few collars available to aid you in making your dog a little bit more dapper looking.
chatgroupsguide-text:
Player Chat Groups Guide
For all of my Friends; Me, Myself and I.

Player Chat Groups are private groups where the members get a new chat tab to talk with each other without cluttering up the General Chat. Most uses for Player Chat Groups would be for Villages, Streamer Chats and even granting Claim Permission to all within a Group.

Note: Do not type the Square [ ] Brackets!
/group create [groupName] Creates a new Player Chat Group with given name.

/group invite [groupName] [playerName] Invites the Player to the Group. Note: Invites do not currently appear anywhere.

/group acceptinvite [groupName] Accepts an Invite for the Group.

/group leave [groupName] Leave the Group.

/group list Lists all Groups you are currently in.

/group info [groupName] Lists the players of a Group.

/group rename [oldGroupName] [newGroupName] Rename the Group.

/group kick [groupName] [playerName] Remove the Player from the Group.

/group op [groupName] [playerName] Grant Operator Status to the Player of the Group.

/group deop [groupName] [playerName] Revoke Operator Status from the Player of the Group.

/group disband [groupName] Destroys the Group. Must be Group Owner to use.
game:characterdesc-rogue:
Slipping through the shadows, eluding capture once again.
This isn't the life you once had, but it's the only one you know of now.

Masters of stealth and experts of both melee and ranged combat, a Rogue walks many paths in search of adventure. This constant action keeps them moving quickly but unable to withstand as much damage.
itemdesc-clothes-upperbody-blacksmith-sh: Warm in the cold and keeps the sparks off.
itemdesc-clothes-upperbody-rogue-shirt: Ragged shirt. Has been through a few adventures.
itemdesc-clothes-head-dark-eye-mask: As long as they don't see the eyes, they will never know.
itemdesc-clothes-foot-rogue-boots: Rugged adventuring boots. Ready for anything.
itemdesc-clothes-foot-ranger-boots: Used by the Ranger's Guild to move silently through the forest.
itemdesc-clothes-shoulder-elvish-coat: The craftsmanship is unrivaled. Only the Elves could have stitched this.
